summary: Email correspondence from Assistant United States Attorney Maurene Comey to attorney Brad Edwards regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys' intention to file a new bail application. The email provides advance notice and offers to discuss the matter.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Recipient of the email notification about Ghislaine Maxwell's upcoming bail application filing.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Sender of the email, notifying Brad Edwards about Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys' intention to file a new bail application and offering to discuss.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the email; her attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

connections.description: Comey, an AUSA, is providing legal case updates to attorney Brad Edwards.
Comey, as an AUSA, is involved in the prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Notice of Intent to File Bail Application
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application, though it had not yet been filed at the time of the email.

locations.name: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, 10007
locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intended to file a new bail application as of December 2020.
The notification was sent by Assistant United States Attorney Maurene Comey to attorney Brad Edwards.
The email serves as advance notice, indicating ongoing legal proceedings and communication between prosecution and other involved counsel.
